ca.uwaterloo.crysp.otr.crypt

Interface MAC

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractMAC, HMAC, JCAHMACSHA1, JCAHMACSHA256, RIMHMACSHA1, RIMHMACSHA256

    public interface MAC
    Interface for signing and verifying data. To use this class, a secret key must first be specified using setKey(). Following this, the tag() and verify() methods can then be used to tag/verify data.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Returns the string representation of the MAC's current state.

      Processes the given bytes.
      void update(byte[] data, int offset, int length)
      Processes the first length bytes in input, starting at offset inclusive.
      boolean verify(byte[] tag, byte[] data)
      Verifies the tag for the data provided.
      boolean verify(byte[] tag, byte[] data, int offset, int length)
      Verifies the tag for the data provided, starting at the provided offset.

      • verify

        boolean verify(byte[] tag,
             byte[] data,
             int offset,
             int length)
               throws OTRCryptException
        Verifies the tag for the data provided, starting at the provided offset.
        Parameters:
        tag - the tag bytes to be verified.
        data - the data to be verified against.
        offset - the offset to start from in the array of bytes.
        length - the number of bytes to use following the offset.
        Returns:
        true if the tag is verified, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        OTRCryptException
